Unbox Robotics - Hardware Design Engineer- I/II/III

Location - Pune Office, Pune Office, Work Type: Full Time

Product July 01, 2022

We are a robot technology company building intralogistics solutions for the new age of warehousing. Our focus is on building compact and flexible solutions and business models to suit the needs of E-commerce and Logistics companies across varying scale and geographies.

We incorporated in 2019 and are based out of Pune, India with a small but swiftly growing team of passionate minds.

Department

Electronics Engineering

Work Experience

1 - 5 years of experience

Salary Range

Competitive Salary

Work Mode

In Campus

Keywords:

Eagle/Altium/Orcad, Microcontroller, debugging, troubleshooting, digital & analog circuit design, MOSFET, Contactors, Power, PCB design, schematic, layout, DSO, DMM

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Members of this team designs, develop and test mobile robot System Software
  • The team will be engaged in the planning, design, development and testing of AGV systems.
  • Design of analogue and digital circuits.
  • Documentation of design specifications and implementation details.
  • Uphold hardware design standards and methodologies.
  • Realization of complex system requirements to provide robust and reliable hardware solutions.
  • Responsibility for the complete implementation of detailed technical items and an understanding/appreciation of system level items.
  • Design for Manufacturing by collaborating with the manufacturing team

Requirements

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in electronics, electrical engineering, or a comparable degree
  • Experience with Eagle/Altium or equivalent software
  • Knowledge of embedded circuit development
  • Knowledge of analogue and digital electronic circuit design.
  • Hands on experience with the soldering iron for the creation of test circuits
  • Experience with microcontrollers (for example, AVR, ARM, Cortex, etc.)
  • Good hardware troubleshooting skills.
  • Able to support/debug system integration
  • Good communicator

Eligible candidates:

  • BE / B. Tech in Electronics or equivalent relevant work experience.
  • Hardware Engineer - I: Min 1 year of experience. Internship experience will be considered.
  • Hardware Engineer - II: 2-3 years of experience
  • Hardware Engineer - III: 3-5 years of experience

We Value:

  • Strong communication skills both oral and written at technical level
  • Work life balance is a big thing for the owners, so they offer flexible hours, deadlines are kept to a minimum and they actively encourage personal projects and contribution to the open-source community.
